definition: to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of

sentences.english: He sits in the front of the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 教室前面有个投币式电话。

sentences.english: Pick up the receive and drop a coin into the slot.
sentences.chinese: 拿起电话筒，然后投一枚硬币到投币孔里去。

sentences.english: Will you please put one dollar and seventy-five cents in the coin slot?
sentences.chinese: 请先将一块七毛五投入投币口，好吗？

sentences.english: Then she ran to the pay-phone to call the polices.
sentences.chinese: 她立刻跑到投币电话亭，打电话报警。

sentences.english: The pay phone is in front of the bank.
sentences.chinese: 投币式公用电话在银行前面。

sentences.english: Deposit a dime in the slot and the door will open.
sentences.chinese: 在投币口投一角钱硬币，门就会自动开。

sentences.english: They put their money in a fare-box or use a public transportation card instead.
sentences.chinese: 他们把钱放在投币箱里或用一张交通卡替代。

sentences.english: And the guy that made this, he made a slot machine out of Lego.
sentences.chinese: 做这个的人，他拿乐高做了个投币自动售货机。

sentences.english: There is a pay phone in front to the classroom…
sentences.chinese: 教室前面有个投币式电话。

sentences.english: Change can be found in pockets and under your machines.
sentences.chinese: 你有可能在投币式自动贩卖机的附近发现零钱。

sentences.english: There is a pay phone in the neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 附近有一个投币式公用电话。

sentences.english: Each group can display coin-freed cumulative number, and time or target control number.
sentences.chinese: 每组都能显示出投币累计数及时间或目标控制数。

sentences.english: You insert the token into the slot of the check-in path.
sentences.chinese: 在地铁检票口把代币放进投币机里。

sentences.english: Please put a coin into the slot.
Passengers without a monthly pass can purchase tickets from coin-operated ticket dispensers.
sentences.chinese: 没有月票的乘客直接到无人售票机前投币购票。

sentences.english: This is actually a coin-operated wine - brewing demonstrator.
sentences.chinese: 其实，这个是一个投币的酿酒工艺演示器。

definition: to use a credit card (or swipe card, smart card etc)
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
